column7: NVH CAE Engineer Location: Raymond, OH What Makes a Honda, is Who makes a Honda Honda has a clear vision for the future, and it’s a joyful one. We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success. We strive to be a company which serves as a source of “power” that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize “the joy and freedom of mobility” by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a “zero environmental footprint.” We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team. If your goals and values align with Honda’s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future! About this Position: The NVH CAE Engineer will utilize computational methods such as finite element analysis to analyze and improve vehicle noise and vibration performance. Strong emphasis in vehicle structural analysis and development will allow engineer to create accurate models, and to work with team to achieve noise performance targets. Responsibilities include: Create CAE models of vehicles including mesh, materials, and properties. Run models using NASTRAN. Post process and analyze results to understand modes, frequency response, transfer functions, and acoustic sensitivity.  Create and champion C/M proposals with technical experts. Maintain schedule to manage project and hit deliverables. Compare test/CAE data; propose suggestions to improve method and correlation. Follow up with team and other functional groups/departments to ensure NV spec is applied. Aid in setting NVH spec for development vehicles. Create evaluation documents. Who we are seeking: Required Work Experience: Internship/co-op experience Required Education: Bachelor’s degree in engineering. Desired skills: Proficient with CAE pre and post processors such as ANSA, Hypermesh, MetaPost Understanding of CAD modelling (CATIA preferred) Experience with vehicle testing on-road & in lab environments using data acquisition equipment advantageous but not required (Simcenter Testlab a plus) Additional Position Factors: Lift 50 lbs Occasional travel 5+ hours overtime per week At Honda, you will play a key role in our journey to become a company that society wants to exist now, and in the future. Your endless curiosity will drive innovation and your courageous spirit will challenge the status quo. We believe having a workforce made up of diverse thinkers and innovators makes us a better Honda. Respect for each other and respect for diversity each and every day drives our associates to contribute at the highest level and work effectively in a team environment. We make the dream of mobility a reality with our innovative and high-quality products. Together, we Bring the Future to our customers, associates, and communities. We are Honda! What differentiates Honda and make us an employer of choice? Total Rewards: Competitive base salary  Annual Bonus Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, personal days 401K Plan with company match + additional contribution Relocation assistance (if eligible) Career Growth: Advancement opportunities Career mobility  Education reimbursement for continued learning Training and Development programs Additional Offerings: Wellbeing program Community service and engagement programs Product programs Free drinks onsite Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!  When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.  Job Description: Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Associate Engineer to join our team! In this role you will get to perform a variety of engineering duties by applying basic engineering techniques and analyses within one discipline. The Engineer at this level is in a developmental mode, being trained under close supervision in the utilization of engineering theories and practices, and gaining exposure to Company procedures. Assignment may be to a structured rotational program which would include experience in Project Controls, Procurement, and Construction Management, as well as through several disciplines in Engineering. Some assignments involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications. Willingness to travel or relocate to supplier, client, or construction site locations is expected. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Performs various engineering and design assignments requiring the application of basic principles and fundamental theories studied in a Bachelors in engineering program, and available data in the engineering field.Prepares or assists in preparing fundamental engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs.Assists in the preparation of detailed requisitions for material purchase, services, and subcontracts.Under the guidance of a more senior engineer, assists in reviewing supplier drawing submittals and technical bid analyses.Assists in the preparation and issuance of specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents.Provides input to CAD Designer/Drafters working on the same project.Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (or related field) and typically 0+ years of related work experience. SKILLS/COMPETENCIES: Requires basic engineering knowledge in electrical, mechanical, civil, or a related field. Familiarity with CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is also required. Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None  This position is part of our Critical Infrastructure team.  For more than 75 years, our experts have designed and delivered the critical infrastructure that connects and protects communities around the world. We work in diverse, collaborative teams, both within the company and with our partners and customers, to plan, design, build, and modernize infrastructure. We take special pride in projects and solutions that improve communities as well as people’s quality of life by promoting economic growth, enhancing mobility, and increasing sustainability and resiliency. Powered by our people, we provide the imagination necessary to support our customers’ visions—and to help them see new possibilities.  Salary Range: $24.18 - $42.31  We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!  The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates. Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.  We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: Entry Level Engineer – Frames and Assemblies
column7: Position Overview:     At Navistar, we’re driving change in the transportation industry and striving to help create a cleaner, more sustainable world where future generations can thrive. With that, it’s an exciting time to be at Navistar, as we work to accelerate the impact of sustainable mobility throughout North America and, with our TRATON GROUP colleagues, worldwide. We are undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks and buses to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.  The Entry Level Engineer – Frames and Assemblies will work under the supervision of the more experienced team members and the Chief engineer. The Engineer will be responsible for design and component updates which includes sustaining and new product development activities.  The position scope is design release, CAD modeling, BOM structure, and development of engineering requirements and verification plans for new product development. Also, includes sustaining projects including current product manufacturing issue problem solving. Duties also include assignments on multiple programs to deliver to cost and quality goals utilizing engineering analysis and experience in metal fabrications, castings, and extrusions.  Responsibilities:  Research and Design new products and systems for customer needsModify existing products or processes to improve vehicle performance using computer-aided design (CAD) and computer-assisted engineering (CAE)Integrate suppliers into design development to create prototypes for Design ValidationDevelop new options and combinations of features to meet customer needsProvide technical support and information to production plant team to ensure product integrityMaintain production orders by performing containments (interim corrective actions) and releases (permanent corrective actions)The role would also include mentoring junior engineers in the accomplishment of the tasks listed.In addition, the candidate will be expected to participate in the budgeting process by estimating program effort and preparing project plans for assigned work. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science   OR  Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology or Computer Science and will obtain degree prior to first day of employment Additional Requirements:      Qualified candidates, excluding current Navistar employees, must be legally authorized on an unrestricted basis (US Citizen, Legal Permanent Resident, Refugee or Asylee) to be employed in the United States. Navistar does not anticipate providing employment related work sponsorship for this position (e.g., H-1B status)    Desired Skills:  Positive Attitude, Ethics and International Values which support our company’s values, and a healthy, high performance culture Experience with 3D CAD software Basic understanding of dimensioning 2D drawings Basic understanding of CAE and material properties Excellent oral, written, and communication skills High level of computer literacy – Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc.) Company Overview:     Navistar, Inc. (“Navistar”) is a purpose-driven company, reimagining how to deliver what matters to create more cohesive relationships, build higher-performing teams and find solutions where others don’t.  Based in Lisle, Illinois, Navistar or its subsidiaries and affiliates produce International® brand commercial trucks and engines, IC Bus® brand school and commercial buses, all-makes OnCommand® Connection advanced connectivity services, and Fleetrite®, ReNEWeD® and Diamond Advantage® brand aftermarket parts.  With a history of innovation dating back to 1831, Navistar has more than 14,500 employees worldwide and is part of TRATON SE, a global champion of the truck and transport services industry. Additional information is available at www.Navistar.com.  Accelerating the Impact of Sustainable Mobility:     Visit us at   www.Navistar.com to discover more about our organization  Navistar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.  #ridewithnavistar

About the Voith Group The Voith Group is a global technology company. With its broad portfolio of systems, products, services and digital applications, Voith sets standards in the markets of energy, paper, raw materials and transport & automotive. Founded in 1867, the company today has around 21,000 employees, sales of € 4.9 billion and locations in over 60 countries worldwide and is thus one of the larger family-owned companies in Europe. Voith Hydro is hiring for: Mechanical Engineer York, PA Interested to learn about Voith? Check out our video "Voith careers" on YouTube. Reasons you’ll love working here: Flexibility with Work/Life Balance Great Compensation and Benefits Package including 401K Climate-Neutral Footprint Worldwide Tuition Reimbursement Target Compensation: $65,000-$72,000 Summary : The Engineer 1 provides design solutions from project inception through production. Performing under close supervision and mentorship by more experienced colleagues, the Engineer 1 uses existing procedures, instruction, and guidance to solve routine engineering design problems. Responsibilities : Preparing/updating designs for customer projects (OTC). Contributing to the Engineering team’s objectives for Process Improvement and Standardization Participating in proposals (OTO) to prepare preliminary design proposals. Operating CAD/CAE equipment to complete work assignments. Collaborating to refine strategies for manufacturing, sourcing, logistics and installation. Performing necessary design calculations (as required) by employing common engineering principles and using hand calculations, proprietary Voith design tools. Creating 3D solid models of components and assemblies. Creating 2D drawings best suited for the manufacturing methods (independently or by collaborating with designers. Searches for and identifies OEM drawings in the archive and customer supplied drawing files. Using SAP to create BoMs (Bill of Materials) best suited for the manufacturing, sourcing, logistics and installation strategy. Participating in design reviews. Preparing design changes and processing change notifications. Supporting the disposition of non-conforming materials, machined/fabricated components and assemblies, and installed/tested assemblies as to adequacy for use. Understanding and following design schedules for project assignments. Keeping supervisors abreast of progress on assigned work (milestones reached, workload, challenges, and delays). Engaging vendors, manufacturing personnel, and field service personnel in defining manufacturing, installation, design solutions that reduce cost and risk. Supporting the quality department with continuous improvement and problem solving activities. Assisting Test Engineers during start-up and commissioning. Evaluating test results and checking on guaranteed values. Preparing and completing technical data reports/forms when needed. Communicating with customers regarding their engineering design-related questions and concerns. Qualifications: Bachelors of Engineering degree Effective teamwork skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task based on business needs Excellent time management skills Where required by local regulations, an engineering license may be required Voith US Inc. is an EEO/AA/VEVRAA compliant Federal Contractor and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. We welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in the industry including people of color, LGBTQI+ community, women, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), Veterans, people of any age or family status. We embrace the competitive advantage that diversity brings and we strive to create a working environment that is inclusive of thought and talent.

Summary      Posted: Oct 6, 2023            Role Number:       200509331      Apple Vision Pro is a revolutionary spatial computer that seamlessly blends digital content with your physical space. It will allow us to do the things we love in ways never before possible — all while staying connected to the people around us! The Vision Product Group is a team of passionate engineers who are designing, prototyping, analyzing, and launching the next new product category at Apple. As part of this group, you will have a uniquely rewarding opportunity to craft future products that will delight and inspire millions of people every day. As a Safety FEA Engineer, you will collaborate with a team of product designers and safety experts to develop strategies to deliver products that preform safely during customer use.     Key QualificationsDemonstrated ability in applying Finite Element Analysis to product development.Strong understanding of structural mechanicsA history of driving projects through the entire development life-cycleSuperior communication skills, both spoken and written; strong collaboration skills, and ability to communicate across varied audiencesAbaqus and ANSA software package experience (preferred)Knowledge of injury assessment techniques and understanding of injury biomechanics (preferred)Material modeling experience (preferred)Description       Do you thrive on developing new ideas and seeing them through to production? This role spans the product design cycle from concept development, prototyping and testing. You will perform Finite Element Analyses on designs that you help generate. You will be an advocate for the safety of our designs, using innovative CAE tools that span dummy headforms as well as human body models. Excellent communication skills including preparing slide presentations and participating in working meetings are critical. An ability to drive good safety outcomes for our customers while operating in a space where the state of the art is quickly advancing is critical. This will require exceptional judgement in balancing product attributes. Travel will be less than 10% (domestic and international)      Education & Experience       MS / PhD in Mechanical / Biomedical / Industrial Engineering (or equivalent experience)      Additional RequirementsPay & BenefitsAt Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $138,900 and $256,500, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.  Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.  Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

column7: Michigan State University (MSU) operates the Facility for Rare Isotope Beams (FRIB) as a user facility for the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Science (DOE-SC), supporting the mission of the DOE-SC Office of Nuclear Physics. FRIB provides researchers with one of the most advanced tools of modern science to study rare isotopes, or short-lived nuclei not normally found on Earth. Hosting what is designed to be the most powerful heavy-ion accelerator, FRIB enables scientists to make discoveries about the properties of rare isotopes, nuclear astrophysics, fundamental interactions, and applications for society, including in medicine, homeland security, and industry. User facility operation is supported by the DOE-SC Office of Nuclear Physics as one of 28 DOE-SC user facilities. MSU’s nuclear physics graduate program is a top-ranked program nationally, according to U.S. News & World Report. This position affords an exciting opportunity to become part of the world-class FRIB Laboratory that enables unique discovery opportunities in nuclear science. Purpose: Entry-level position administering the CAE/CAD/PDM systems and designing innovative technical devices supporting heavy-ion accelerator development and operation. Major Duties/Responsibilities: CAE/CAD/PDM AdministrationProvide active support to assist users of all CAE/CAD systems as neededDevelop and maintain automated tools to aid in engineering activitiesManage CAD License use for FRIB Mechanical Design DepartmentManage PDM Licenses for the entire FRIB FacilityAdminister file permissions within PDM systemMaintain and develop PDM system workflowsMechanical Design    Produce and document effective design solutions by developing concepts and creating CAD designs/detailsAssists with project leader and subject matter experts to transform technical requirements into design solutionsAssist project leader and subject matter experts in reviewing design layouts, budgets, project documentation for construction, testing, modification of hardware and software and/or the installation of sub-systemsPerforms other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the duties in this job classification.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Proficiency with Programmatic Codes: Python, C/C+++, Visual Basic, MATLABProficiency with SolidWorks and ADEPT.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suites.Mechanical Engineering Expertise –knowledge and understanding of practices of engineering, and sound judgment regarding their implementation to contribute to organizational performance and success.Proven ability to produce quality work and perform several assignments in parallelCommunication – effectively articulating and exchanging information with stakeholders at all levels—internal and external.    Ability to interact with customers, identify requirements, and estimate resources for assigned work.Service Focus – the ability to identify and meet appropriate client expectations by offering high-quality services and solutions tailored to diverse client and stakeholder needs.Collaboration & Teamwork – the ability to work effectively with others.Continuous Learning – the ability to maintain continuous improvement.Ethical Practice – the ability to support and uphold the values of the organization while balancing and mitigating risk. Unit Specific Education/Experience/Skills Bachelor’s degree in Systems or Computer Science; or Engineering or Physics, with coursework in Systems or Computer Science; one to three years of related and progressively more responsible or expansive work experience in electronics, mechanical and/or electrical drafting and fabrication techniques, or computer programming in one or more languages used by the FRIB; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Desired QualificationsOne year of experience with CAD/CAEOne year of experience with Programmatic CodesOne year of experience with SolidWorksExperience in the design and fabrication of sophisticated research equipmentWork experience in fabrication techniques, cryogenic systems, electronics, mechanical and electronic drafting and computer systemsAbility to work with export-controlled materialsEqual Employment Opportunity Statement All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or protected veteran status. Required Application Materials Please provide a cover letter, resume and three professional references from your last three employers. Work Hours STANDARD 8-5 Website frib.msu.edu Bidding eligibility ends November 28, 11:55 PM

CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: Structural Analysis Engineer (Entry Level, New College Grad) - 243QE
column7: About Quartus Quartus Engineering Incorporated (www.quartus.com) is a leading provider of advanced computer-aided engineering (CAE) services and integrated hardware solutions for a wide range of clients and industries. We are a recognized leader in simulation-driven engineering services and custom development of highly-engineered systems. We leverage our engineering analysis capabilities with design, prototype, integration and test capabilities to create advanced solutions for our clients. What will you do? As an Analysis Engineer you will perform analysis-driven design thru building structural, thermal, and fluids models, running simulations, performing optimization and redesign, correlating simulations to match testing, and delivering results to our customers. We perform analysis and testing of a wide variety of linear and non-linear systems ranging from aircraft and spacecraft to optical systems and consumer products. You will gain exposure to an array of leading commercial simulation software such as NASTRAN, Abaqus, ANSYS, Hypermesh, FEMAP, Thermal Desktop, and STAR-CCM+. Essential Job Functions:Generate finite element models (FEMs), thermal models, and/or CFD modelsVerify that parts and systems are adequately designed for requirements and environmentsAssist in redesign and optimization of areas not meeting load & environment requirementsGenerate custom codes to speed, improve, or expand analysis workflow and capabilitiesPerform pre-test analyses and model correlationPresent findings and recommendations to the project team, company or customerDocument work using Microsoft Word or PowerPoint What is an example project?Our Analysis Engineers performed aeroelastic flutter analysis on the Stratolaunch Airplane as well as FE modeling and composite stress analysis of nearly all parts of the airplane.As an entry-level Analysis Engineer, you would contribute to this project by building and maintaining Finite Element Models (FEM) and computing stress margins, joint margins, strength ratios, acceleration loads, flutter stability margins, etc. Location Position can be based in San Diego CA, Herndon VA, or Seattle WA with a hybrid schedule. Who is right for the job? Successful candidates must be highly collaborative team player who are committed to Quartus values: People First, Integrity, Curiosity and Bold. We hire resourceful individuals with a passion for learning and an ability to apply engineering principles and techniques to solve a variety of problems. What are we looking for?BS or MS (typically in mechanical, aerospace, structural, or similar engineering field)Some training in finite element analysis (FEA)Must be a US Person (US Citizen or Legal Permanent Resident)Preferred - experience with FEMAP, Hypermesh, NASTRAN, Abaqus, ANSYS, MATLAB, Python Compensation and Benefits Referral eligibility: Tier 1 Quartus is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to employing a diverse workforce, including, but not limited to, minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans. Quartus provides comprehensive benefits including competitive salary, discretionary performance-based bonus, employee stock ownership plan, medical, dental, vision, and 401k plan with company match.

Company Description  CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers. The Team: Our team supports best-in-class product design by applying high quality standards in CAD modeling and applying advanced engineering simulation techniques. We leverage our experience in design for assembly and manufacturing to promote the most effective designs while paying attention to cost and structural concerns. Team members utilize global resources to accomplish their tasks and extend our effective reach. No challenge goes unaccepted. Job Description  The Opportunity: The Associate Computer Application Engineer (CAE) will work within the Mechanical Design and CAE department located in East Aurora and report directly to the Manager, Mechanical Design & Computer Applications Engineering. Primary tasks include working with Product Development Engineers to setup 3D simulations of products based on internal standards, regulatory requirements, or general concerns. The Associate Engineer (CAE) will be responsible for predicting and diagnosing potential concerns and identifying solutions. We have a global footprint, so expect projects to come from anywhere in the world. What Your Impact Will Be: Provide accurate structural analysis of toys using computer applications Become an expert in a variety of software applications to support responsibilities including:    3D CAD development of parts and assemblies, mechanism design in a CAD environment, Finite Element Analysis (FEA) and molding analysis Apply fundamental engineering knowledge to make decisions and validate results Research new materials, apply to simulations and verify accuracy Work within team environment to deliver high quality results in a timely manner Document projects and retain information to support future initiatives Qualifications  What We’re Looking For: Must have BS Degree in Engineering Experience, interest and drive for CAD modeling and engineering simulation Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills Prior experience with engineering simulation applications is a plus Demonstrated a growth mindset by staying curious and continuously learning, embracing challenges, and improving themselves. The annual base salary range for this position is between $56,000 and $70,000. **This range is indicative of projected hiring range, however annual base salary will be determined based on a candidate’s work location, skills and experience. Additional Information  Don’t meet every single requirement? At Mattel we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.  What It’s Like to Work Here:  We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors: We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower. We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking. We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results. Who We Are:  Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. Mattel is recognized for the second year in a row as a Great Place to Work™ and as one of Fast Company’s Best Workplaces for Innovators in 2022.  Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers.  Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: Test Engineer, Chassis & Body in White, Semi
column7: What to Expect  This position will work as a member of Tesla’s reliability and test team to develop and execute component and system level testing of vehicle chassis and body structural components using servo hydraulic test equipment either in-house or at external labs What You’ll Do  Conduct hands-on component and system level durability and strength tests using MTS servo hydraulic systems Work directly with reliability and design engineers for test planning activities (test scheduling, prioritization, specifications etc. ) Develop test fixtures using CAD and work with in-house or external labs for fixture fabrication Conduct detailed inspections such as torque checks, crack checks etc. Identify and root cause failures Conduct data acquisition and instrumentation of sensors such as load cells, strain gages, LVDT etc. Post process test data and make detailed test reports Be involved with general test equipment maintenance and lab expansions Work in close collaboration with test technicians, instrumentation, CAE, reliability and design teams Work with third party labs to coordinate and conduct testing as needed Maintain a clean and organized work environment What You’ll Bring  BS and/or MS degree in mechanical, automotive or mechatronics engineering or equivalent experience. Strong internship experience and/or participation in competitive projects (Formula SAE etc.) preferred Experience with testing, using hydraulic or electric actuators preferred Experience with instrumentation of sensors (load cells, strain gages, LVDT etc.) and data acquisition systems Experience designing in CAD Proven track record as a hands-on engineer Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines Excellent written & verbal communication skills Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail

CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: High Voltage Battery Electrical Systems Analysis (CAE) Engineer
column7: Job Description This Role Offers the Following Work Appropriately Strategy: Hybrid This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time but the general expectation is that the employee be onsite an average of one-to-three days each week. The Role The High Voltage Battery Electrical Systems Analysis (CAE) Engineer, in the Global Electrification Battery Systems (GEBS) department, will be responsible to execute one dimensional electrical component and sub-system models for electrical and electronics components like batteries, fuses, cables, connectors, contactors, BDU, busbars, current collector plate, CMU and other battery electronics. The analysis engineer will be also responsible to support development of new analysis capabilities in the space of High and Low Voltage electrical systems to support hardware reduction goals. The analysis engineer will interpret and present results to decision makers at key program gates for GM Global Vehicle Development Program. The analysis engineer will be required to interact closely with team members and work cross functionally to deliver standard work. What You'll Do Develop high voltage battery and electrical systems models using tools like Saber, Spice, Matlab and Simulink Perform electrical circuit analysis to deliver design solutions which are robust and reliable, utilizing optimization and statistical methods when appropriate Work collaboratively with Battery System Integration Engineers, Electrical Architects, Advanced Engineers, Program teams and Component Hardware Design teams to ensure system requirements are met, design concepts are evaluated, and development and validation plans are successful Support new analysis capability development and document new standard procedures Ensure on time delivery of high-quality results Additional Job Description Your Skills & Abilities (Required Qualifications) BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Mechanical Engineering 2+ yrs of experience with analysis, design and/or testing of high and low voltage electrical components and sub-systems with electrified vehicles (BEV, EREV, PHEV, HEV, BAS) Experience in Synopsys Saber or comparable Electrical Circuit Analysis tools like Spice, Simplorer, Matlab and Simulink Good understanding of electrical systems, controls and component development / validation Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills What Will Give You A Competitive Edge (Preferred Qualifications) MS or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Mechanical Engineering Experience with development and usage of CAE/CAD tools Black belt in performing DFSS analysis Knowledge of Lithium-ion battery cell modeling and simulation Modeling (or other cell chemistries: Lead Acid, etc.) Experience in applying Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) methods About GM Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all. Why Join Us We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:   Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents; Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family; Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement; Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values; Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing; Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends. CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: Mechanical Design Engineer (Entry Level, New College Grad) - 235QE
Mechanical Design Engineer, Seat Belt Systems
column7: What to Expect     Engineer to design & deliver high performance seat belt systems for the current & upcoming Tesla vehicle programs.   What You’ll Do  The design release of all seat belt systems in the vehicle, product packaging, validation, & consideration for robust and efficient manufacturing processes Act as the primary technical interface to the design studio, body, interior & seat engineering teams to develop the optimum seat belt packages for occupant protection performance, comfort, and interior styling Manage and direct tier 1 suppliers for engineering development and program timing Support all testing and production validation to meet occupant injury and product performance criteria per established Tesla targets, and regulatory requirements Support restraint system integration work. Provide expertise on seat belt design to ensure five-star NCAP safety ratings for our new vehicles. Work closely with CAE team to provide design inputs and utilize CAE results to optimize component design Support crash tests from early development to homologation phase. Ensure components are supplied to correct pedigrees for all test vehicles and other vehicle level validation and homologation requirements Support supplier & field quality issues to ensure high quality products for our customers Support work on R&D projects to design the next level restraint system What You’ll Bring  A Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or other technical discipline required. Relevant mechanical design engineering project experience on a university or professional level Ability to work out ways around obstacles, see opportunities while facing technical difficulties and restrictive timing Effective verbal and written skills to articulate technical issues with peers and suppliers Engineering fundamentals in problem solving & strong hands-on skills Knowledge of manufacturing methods and component/assembly tolerancing Intermediate/Advanced 2D drawing & 3D modeling CAD skills (preferably CATIA) Excellent organizational skills, self-starting and self-motivated Automotive safety restraints system experience, especially in seat belt design Good understanding and experience in vehicle crashworthiness Working knowledge of relevant regulations & requirements (FMVSS/ECE/GB/etc)

column7: Job Description This Role Offers the Following Work Appropriately Strategy: Hybrid This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time but the general expectation is that the employee be onsite an average of one-to-three days each week. We work alongside the best and brightest to do incredibly cool things you wouldn't believe. At Roush, you're part of building the future. Are you someone that has a passion for providing innovated solutions to complex challenges? Do you want to work someplace where creativity and new ideas are encouraged? If so, then keep reading. We fuse technology and engineering to provide product development solutions to customers in a diverse range of industries. Widely recognized for providing engineering, testing, prototype, and manufacturing services to the transportation industry, Roush also provides significant support to the aerospace, defense and theme park industries. With over 2,400 employees in facilities throughout the United States, Europe, Asia, and South America, our unique combination of creativity and tenacity activates big ideas on a global stage. Roush has an immediate need within our Advanced Engineering department for an entry-level Design & Development Engineer to join our team. The engineer will coordinate multiple engineering and testing projects, and work hands-on in a test lab, test cell, or vehicle environment. The engineer will also develop validation strategies for components, follow through with testing, generate 3D Computer-Aided Design (CAD) models, and conduct structural simulations to validate designs. This position is based out of Livonia, MI. As an Entry-level Mechanical Engineer, you will: Coordinate multiple engineering and testing projects for a variety of customers Work hands-on in test lab, test cell or vehicle environment Develop validation strategies for components and follow through with testing Generate 3D CAD models and conduct structural simulations to validate designs Coordinate internal support activities in professional and shop environment departments (i.e., testing, machine shop, engine build, fabrications, garage services, etc.) Prepare and deliver technical reports and presentations for status reviews and project sign-off Support component and system design activities Perform research on emerging technologies and implement on programs Manage bill of materials for mechanical systems To be considered for an Entry-level Mechanical Engineer, you will need: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering Minimum 1 year of engineering experience in automotive or other related industry (may include co-ops and/or internship experience) Experience as a member of Formula SAE, Mini Baja or equivalent hands-on experience Knowledge of 2D/3D CAD (Computer-Aided Design) and an understanding of CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) practices Must be a US citizen Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Ability to work independently or in a team and handle several assignments simultaneously Ability to handle new technical assignments independently with minimal guidance MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint proficiency A successful candidate may also have: Master’s degree in a science or technical field Engine dynamometer or laboratory testing experience Hybrid, electric, hydrogen or autonomous vehicle experience A valid driver’s license with a safe driving record Ability to drive manual transmission vehicles Our full-time benefits include: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, earned sick time, STD, LTD, 401K, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, paid holidays, and more. If you share our passion for providing innovative solutions to complex challenges, we want you on our team. Please visit our careers page and apply by clicking on this link: https://jobs.roush.com/us/en/ Visit our website: www.roush.com Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/RoushCareers Roush is an EO employer – Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories If you need a reasonable accommodation for our employment application process due to disability, please contact Roush Talent Acquisition at 734-779-7087.

JOB DESCRIPTION: We are looking for a creative Mechanical Engineer to work on all product stages from research and development to design and manufacture, through to installation and final commissioning. The goal is to design and fabricate mechanical components of innovation and excellence.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Perform a full lifecycle product development (design, develop, test prototypes, manufacture and implement)Design systems and components that meet needs and requirementsProduce outline designsConduct experiments methodically, analyze data and interpret resultsTest and evaluate theoretical designsIdentify, formulate and produce effective solutions to emerging problemsEvaluate final product's overall performance, reliability and safetyAlter and modify design to meet requirements and to eliminate malfunctionsEstimate budget and scope of projectSolicit observations from operatorsPrepare product reports and documentationEngage in lifelong learning and develop new theories or methodsRequirements:  REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, EDUCATION, AND ABILITIES: Proven working experience in mechanical engineeringWorking experience with product lifecycle management (PLM), finite element analysis (FEA) and computational fluid dynamics (CFD)Hands-on experience with computer-aided engineering (CAM) and computer-aided manufacturing (CAE)Familiarity with 2D or 3D engineering design and manufacturing tools (e.g., AutoCAD, ProE or other)Adequate knowledge of engineering analysis tools (ANSYS, ProMechanica or similar)Mathematical computing and analysis tools knowledge (Matlab, Excel, LabView etc)Solid understanding of core concepts including mechanics, kinematics, thermodynamics, materials science etc.Creativity and analytical skillsAbility to communicate technical knowledge in a clear and understandable mannerTechnical writing skillsBSc degree in Engineering

CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: R&D Engineer II - Modeling & Simulation - Golden Valley, MN
column7: Job Description:   OVERVIEW We are seeking an intellectually curious engineer with strong mathematics and theoretical background who is eager to apply modern modeling and simulation methodologies to solve complex and challenging food design and processing problems. You will work with engineers and scientists to design, develop, and optimize our current and next-generation food processes to make food the world loves!  This role is within our ITQ’s Nutrition, Technology, & Science organization. In NTS, we help our Operating Unit-aligned R&D teams transform consumer-centric possibilities into realities through science. We build and advance technical solutions to enable innovations and drive efficiencies in ingredients, process, packaging, and products.  What You’ll Be Doing:    We are looking for a Master’s or Ph.D. engineering degree holder with a strong academic background who can analyze real-world situations using data-centric and phenomenon-based modeling tools. Applying multiple lenses such as process dynamics, fluid and solid mechanics, reaction kinetics, heat and mass transfer, and process control, you will work independently or with a team to:  Leverage fundamental chemical and/or mechanical engineering principles to dissect and understand how great-tasting food is made on our equipment. Apply computer-aided engineering (CAE) modeling, process modeling, and data-driven or machine learning techniques to analyze and develop a hypothesis to solve complex engineering problems that will improve process efficiency and product quality. Develop cutting-edge hybrid simulation methodologies and tools, such as multiphysics modeling or hybrid mechanistic modeling / machine learning to drive learning. Integrate cross-disciplinary software and hardware tools as needed for problems at hand (e.g. Visual Basic/Python programming, PLC programming, vision systems, computer-aided design (CAD), etc.). Design and execute experiments in concert with collaborators to test hypotheses, generate data needed for model validation, and scale-up / scale-down to translate insights. Develop modeling and simulation approaches in tandem with experimentation to advance technical possibilities, drive technical learning, deliver adopted solutions to problems, and capture big business impact. General Mills advocates employee personal development and growth. The successful candidate will have the opportunity for advancement either within our digital transformation pillar or gain new experience by moving across other exciting areas within Innovation, Technology & Quality. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Support the development and advancement of data and modeling-based problem-solving methodologies within GMI. Partner with your immediate working team and cross-functional domain experts to develop winning solutions for technically challenging business and consumer problems. Provide scientific and engineering guidance and leadership-by-example through a rigorous approach to problem solving. Maintain positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with the team, partners, and key stakeholders. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related competitive engineering field Experience or interest in modeling, simulation, scientific development, analytics, and programming Strong theoretical and practical mechanical aptitude Passion for analyzing existing data and generating new data through experimentation A learning mindset with curiosity & inventiveness A proactive, deep-rooted drive to uncovering possibility and executing on opportunity Demonstrated ability to work in teams, collaborate with others to deliver results Ability to focus on details, apply a methodical approach to tackle technical challenges PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Ph.D. degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related competitive engineering field Proven record of scientific excellence and data-driven decision making Deep data and analytics, modeling and simulation, and computer science experience Industrial internship experience Demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding results Demonstrated skills in managing numerous projects concurrently and adaptability to fast-growing/constantly changing stakeholder needs Demonstrated effective communication, leadership, and influencing skills Ability to design and execute experiments to understand and solve technical problems, strong technical background Innovative thinker, willing to challenge established methods and beliefs At this time, General Mills is unable to provide sponsorship for individuals unable to work within the United States without company assistance in an on-going fashion.  Company Overview:     We exist to make food the world loves. But we do more than that. Our company is a place that prioritizes being a force for good, a place to expand learning, explore new perspectives and reimagine new possibilities, every day. We look for people who want to bring their best — bold thinkers with big hearts who challenge one other and grow together. Because becoming the undisputed leader in food means surrounding ourselves with people who are hungry for what’s next.

Nissha Medical Technologies is looking for a Design Engineer I to join our Engineering Team in Wolcott, CT. The main focus of the job is to provide entry level technical contribution to the design and development of Medical Device product solutions based on the design inputs provided by the customer requirements. These product solutions may be systems that are mechanically or electromechanically based. The design process utilized shall be in compliance with Quality System and standard operating procedures of Biomedical Innovations/Sequel. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES:Follows all employee guidelines and Quality Systems Regulations (QSR's) as defined by NMT's practices, policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) to ensure that customer requirements and FDA (or equivalent) regulations are met.Demonstrates knowledge and acts in accordance with NMT's Employee Guidelines and applicable quality standards as outlined in NMT's Quality Manual.Develop product specifications derived from customer requirementsConceptualize new product solutions that are capable of meeting customer requirements based on product specifications. These solutions may include principles of solid mechanics, fluids mechanics, thermodynamics, and thermal mechanics. These solutions may require integration of electrical and software elements provided by other team members.Perform engineering analysis as a means of verifying that product concepts have engineering merit and have a high likelihood of meeting the product specifications.Perform detailed design of product solutions including CAD Modeling, Design for Manufacturability and Assembly, Material selection, and Drawing Specifications.Develop detailed drawing of components and assemblies identifying critical criteria to insure product quality.Identify suppliers of components and procure prototype component samples.Perform initial engineering builds of design prototypes.Perform prototype evaluations and debug samples as required.Develop test methods and procedures for verifying that a design meets the product specifications.Prepare protocols and reports of various types included as part of design verification.Develop procedures and instructions for assembling product designs.Specify or modify production processing equipment required for manufacturing the product.Research and develop custom manufacturing processes as requiredDesign, fabricate, and verify the installation of assembly fixturing and manufacturing aids.Identify, document, and verify critical in-process and final acceptance product quality criteria.Verify and validate production equipment, processes, and test methods.Support and participate in the risk management process required by the medical device industrySupport, guide, and train production personnel in learning the process assembly instructions for the product design.Supports the maintenance of the Engineering lab space by managing calibration of test equipment, maintaining orderly workspaces, and requisitioning management for procuring required lab materials.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.Manages and communicates with customers and suppliers in a professional manner thereby maintaining the company's quality reputation.Other duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTS:At a minimum this role requires a Bachelor's Degree in an Engineering Discipline (preferably Mechanical, Biomedical, or Aeronautical).0 to 3 years of Design related experience is preferred but not required. Internship experience will be considered on a case by case basis.Computer skills to include Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, Excel and SolidWorks (Required). Minitab, Creo/Pro Engineer, MathCAD and Marc/Mentat or similar CAE Software preferred.Working knowledge of Dimensioning and Tolerancing to ASME Y14.5 is preferred.Has a desire to gain experience designing disposable multicomponent mechanical systems with between 15-50 componentsWorking knowledge of Engineering Statistics is preferred.Skill in engineering analysis in specific areas of study including Mechanics of Materials, Strength of Materials, Static Analysis, Dynamics, and Mechanism Analysis is required.Basic understanding of Plastics and Metals including processes for manufacturing these components for the healthcare industry is preferred.Basic understanding of the fundamentals of Finite Element analysis is preferred.Understanding basic methods of inspection is preferred.Ability to conceptualize and document creative mechanical solutions to challenging problems are required.Physical hand assembly common to the production environment is required for this position.Ability to use basic machine shop equipment is required for this position. Use of drill presses, grinding wheels, manual lathes, etc. is a must.Ability to perform testing, collect data, and analyze data is required. The established Compensation Range for this position will be $65,000-$75,000 per year (paid on a bi-weekly basis) based on experience and qualifications.  Great benefits available including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Basic and Voluntary Life Insurance, Paid Vacation Time, Paid Sick Leave, Educational Assistance, and more!  Nissha Medical Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. In addition, NMT will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance with completing the online application process, please call (719) 426-9074.

What to Expect     As a Closures Systems Design Engineer, you will be responsible for conceiving, architecting, designing, and engineering the dynamic exterior systems of Tesla vehicles. You will work alongside pioneering Designers and Engineers through all stages of the product design cycle: From initial sketch and clay modeling, through architecture and design, and finally to validation and product launch. You will be part of the team that creates and executes some of the most notable hallmarks of Tesla design.   What You’ll Do  Establish system level architecture and functionality based on market research, design feasibility and prototyping Work closely with body team to lead master section, sealing flange and hinge axis development Interpret/develop Tolerance Analysis, DVP&R, CAE, DFM, DFMEA, PFMEA simulations/results and integrate feedback into designs What You’ll Bring  Knowledge of vehicle engineering crash and safety requirements Strong understanding of engineering principles, mechanics of materials and the ability to think out of the box

Quest Defense is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world's fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are part of a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility. We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers. As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we're eager to hear from you. The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek have the following characteristics and skills: Potential Job Functions The essential description of the role is working with a major gas turbine OEM on new development engines and owning the design and/or structural analysis of various components Capture system requirements from the customer and incorporate into the component design Support technical substantiation Contribute and present in technical and program reviews Develop components and modules keeping cost, performance, life, and system requirements in mind Design and Analysis of the component using CAE tools (NX, ANSYS Classic, ANSYS workbench) Direct interface with other internal/external engineering areas Apply technical principles, theories, and concepts to solve a wide range of challenging engineering problems. Evaluate fit, form, function and life of the components relative to the certified configuration. This position description is not intended to be all-inclusive and employee will also perform other tasks as assigned #cj Qualifications We're excited to talk to you if your qualifications meet the following criteria:  1-3 years of experience in the mechanical design engineering of gas turbine components Expertise with hot structures, turbine frames, combustors, exhausts or compressor cases is desired Design requirements Manufacturing requirements Strength, fatigue, and durability properties Installation and aircraft operation Aircraft certification requirements Materials, processes, and part standards Production capabilities and limitations MRB Procedures Minimum BS/B.Tech in Mechanical or Aerospace engineering from an accredited university Experience with UG NX Experience with ANSYS (Classic or workbench) Ability to easily interpret technical drawings with understanding of GD&T Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, work under time constraints, maintain composure and handle multiple tasks simultaneously Ability to interact with employees/managers at all levels with strong oral and written communication skills Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment Like to work in a fast paced, creative environment Enjoy people and dynamic teams with diverse experiences. We have fun together! Due to nature of work aa DoD Secret/Collateral clearance is required Quest Defense provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! Peterbilt Motors Company On highways, construction sites, city streets, logging roads - everywhere our customers earn their living - Peterbilt's red oval is a familiar symbol of performance, reliability and pride. Peterbilt has reigned as America's premium quality truck manufacturer since the company's founding in 1939. Our dedication to deliver products and services focused on improving customers' performance, image, profitability and peace of mind truly makes Peterbilt the Class of the Industry. Requisition Summary The Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for engineering investigation, research, design, and analysis of air, ABS and stability control systems on the vehicle. Duties involve root cause analysis, problem definition, problem resolution and reporting of work to upper management. Engineering projects may include new product development, current production design & support, field service & warranty, factory process improvements and service tool enhancements. This position is based at Peterbilt Division Headquarters in Denton, Texas. The Mechanical Engineer will collaborate with suppliers and other divisions within PACCAR: DAF, Kenworth, PACCAR Technical Center and the PACCAR Engine Company. Travel to these facilities as well as testing locations will occasionally be required. Job Functions & Responsibilities Coordinates design efforts with other engineering groups and departments within PACCAR. Assigns, approves, performs or delegates designs as appropriate. Analyzes data from warranty claims to support future designs. Utilizes Creo Parametric as a CAD design tool and Windchill for data management. Apply knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing principles. Initiates and implements designs of a complex nature following Design For Six Sigma. Leads meetings with team members and monitors progress toward achieving project goals. Prepares engineering activity status reports and other detailed reporting as directed. Identifies, prioritizes and coordinates resolutions of production, production control and Quality Assurance issues as appropriate. Performs calculations, design analysis, testing evaluation and implementation necessary for successful product implementation. Occasional travel required. Qualifications & Skills Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related degree is required. Knowledge of and/or experience in heavy truck assembly, heavy truck components and systems is preferred. Previous design experience of parts and assemblies will be given preference. Knowledge of chassis layouts and system design is preferred. Knowledge of component analysis & validation techniques is preferred, including FEA/CAE. Proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint and good presentation skills. Ability to learn on the fly and adapt to change. Ability to maintain progress on multiple projects and tasks. Knowledge of vehicle system design including pneumatic, ABS, and stability control is preferred. Knowledge of vehicle vocations, applications, and how the customer uses the truck is preferred. Knowledge and experience with FMVSS and CMVSS, especially 105, 106, 121 and 136 is preferred. Knowledge of brakes, hubs, wheels, tires, mechatronics and routing is preferred. Competencies     Act with Integrity        Demonstrate Adaptability        Drive for Results        Influence Others        Lead Innovation and Quality Initiatives        Manage Execution        Manage Talent        Technical Acumen        Use Sound Judgment / Business Acumen    Additional Job Board Information PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability corporation. Peterbilt promotes Diversity and Inclusion through mentorship, events, and affinity support groups – The Diversity Council, Peterbilt Women’s Initiative (PBWin), Veterans Group, Peterbilt Black Organization for Leadership and Development (B.O.L.D) and ADVOCATE (An LGBTQ support group).

CAE Analysis Engineer, Structures & Dura: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer, Semi Drive Axle, Drive Systems
column7: What to Expect      We are a small, fast team of capable engineers. We specialize in architecture layouts and detail design of mass efficient castings and forgings like gearboxes and motor housings. We also work in plastics, sheet metal and bolted joint designs. Our work often has us reach across borders to our neighboring teams inside the drive unit and the rest of the vehicles where our Drive Units are used. Fast time to market is part of our DNA and we deliver products much faster than industry standard. The Tesla Semi is no exception.    What You’ll Do  Bring leadership and contribute a high level to the design and development of semi-truck and heavy-duty transmission designs and architectures Work with vehicle and production line integration teams to ensure successful assembly and service with the greater vehicle Work with reliability teams to diagnose and address and improve designs based on test results or issues in the field Develop designs with a heavy concentration on design for assembly at volume, in conjunction with manufacturing engineering team Own the detail design of individual components of the assembly, from the very first concept ideas all the way though sourcing collaboration, first parts incoming inspection, PPAP of volume produced parts Work with the analysis and test team to define specs, and guide fixture design for testing Engage and drive the project team for an on-time delivery What You’ll Bring  Heavy duty/Class 8 transmission design with focus on structural castings System level design ownership 3DExperience or Catia V5 experience strongly preferred Casting design for volume production Detail 3D and 2D release of Iron and aluminum casting, forgings, and molded parts Component and sub-system level structural CAE, experience in working in conjunction with CAE specialists for more complex analyses Excellent attention to detail Strong understanding of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) Great time management and self-motivation

Glendale, CA - Design and analyze mechanical design components and systems associated with mechanisms and structures. Support engineering proposals, budgets, and project tasks. Work both independently and with the supervision of a senior engineer. Mentor Junior Engineers and delegate engineering tasks. Meet with clients. Decide on a project's Concept Engineering. Design Concept Review and Approval, Engineering Submittal Review and Approval. Perform engineering analysis and generate designs. Utilize various building materials and design codes. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent from ABET-accredited university. 3 years associated at all levels of design, analysis, and manufacturing. 3 years in analysis software and knowledge of current design codes and standards including American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), American Society of Testing and Materials (ASTM), American Welding Society (AWS), American Institute of Steel Construction (AISC 360), American Society of Civil Engineers 7 (ASCE 7) and Guobiao Standards (GB). 3 years of direct engineering and design in steel, concrete, and aluminum structures. 3 years with amusement ride engineering, mechanical design, shop drawing creation, shop drawing review, metallurgical strength analysis, metallurgical fatigue analysis, weld analysis, finite element analysis (FEA), wind engineering, and earthquake engineering. 3 years in Solidworks and ANSYS Workbench and PTC CREO, Mathcad, Autodesk ACAD, LIMIT – CAE Simulation Solutions, MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 1 year of directly performing facility acceptance testing (FAT) and site acceptance testing (SAT). Passing of the NCEES FE exam. Please submit resumes and questions to: careers@celticengineering.com and specify the position for which you are applying.

To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.          Impulse Space is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Impulse Space is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.    About Impulse Space    Founded in 2021 by    Tom Mueller, a founding member of SpaceX. Impulse Space was founded with the belief that gaining access to space is only part of the job – if you want to get to orbit, you’ll go with one of our launch partners, but if you want to get anywhere else in space, Impulse will take you there.      Our mission is to    accelerate humanity's future in space through efficient transportation anywhere. GEO, the Moon, Mars, and beyond; Impulse is the way to get anywhere in space. We’ll do this with Helios, a powerful kick stage that will bring large payloads from LEO to GEO & beyond, and Mira, a hosting and orbital transfer vehicle that is optimized to make the trip to and operate in GEO.  DepartmentPropulsion EngineeringEmployment TypeFull TimeLocationRedondo Beach Workplace typeOnsiteCompensation$90,000 - $140,000 / yearReporting ToKevin Miller, VP of Manufacturing
